title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.7 - Prohibited activities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1150.7 - Prohibited activities

State Regulations

No person, unless duly authorized by the authority, shall at
any terminal: (a) Sell, or offer for
sale, directly or indirectly, expressly or impliedly, any purchase; or
(b) Solicit any business or
trade, including the carrying of baggage for hire or the shining of shoes or
bootblacking; or
(c) Entertain or
endeavor to entertain any persons by singing, dancing, playing any musical
instrument or pantomime or any behavior whatsoever. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1150.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
